IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"setAuthority(address)":{"details":"Transfers control to a new authority. _isCompliant(address,address).details: The function checks if the provided account complies with the attestation.

params.account: The address of the user whose access is being verified.

enforce(address,(address,address,address.details: Rights Policies Manager contract should be the only one allowed to call this method.

params.agreement: An object containing the terms agreed upon between the asset holder and the user.
params.holder: The rights holder whose authorization is required for accessing the asset.

returns._0: The address of the provider associated with the policy.

params.assetId: the asset ID to retrieve the holder.

params.account: The address of the account for which the attestation is being retrieved.
params.criteria: Encoded data containing the parameters required to retrieve attestation. eg: assetId, holder, groups, etc

isConsumingScheduledOp().details: Returns true only in the context of a delayed restricted call, at the moment that the scheduled operation is being consumed. Prevents denial of service for delayed restricted calls in the case that the contract performs attacker controlled calls.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

setAuthority(address).details: Transfers control to a new authority. The caller must be the current authority.

setup(address,bytes).details: Only the Rights Policies Authorizer contract has permission to call this function.

params.holder: The address of the holder for whom the policy is being initialized.
params.init: Initialization data required to configure the policy.

params.interfaceId: The bytes4 identifier of the interface to check for support.

returns._0: A boolean indicating whether the interface ID is supported (true) or not (false).

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

_isCompliant(address,address).notice: Verifies whether the on-chain access terms are satisfied for an account.

description().notice: Returns the business/strategy model implemented by the policy.

enforce(address,(address,address,address.notice: Executes the agreement between the asset holder and the account based on the policy's rules.

getAttestationProvider().notice: Retrieves the address of the attestation provider.

getHolder(uint256).notice: Returns the asset holder registered in the ownership contract.

getLicense(address,bytes).notice: Retrieves the license id associated with a specific account.

isAccessAllowed(address,bytes).notice: Verifies if an account has access to holder's content or asset id.

isActive().notice: Checks if the policy has been initialized.

name().notice: Returns the name of the policy.

resolveTerms(bytes).notice: Retrieves the terms associated with a specific criteria and policy.

setup(address,bytes).notice: Initializes the policy with specific data for a given holder.

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Checks if a given interface ID is supported by this contract.

documentation.text: @dev Structure to define a subscription package.
@notice Returns the name of the policy.

expression.value:
This policy follows a subscription model with daily pricing, allowing users to access a content holder's catalog by paying a daily fee for a chosen duration.

Key features:
1) Flexible subscription periods set by the asset holder.
2) Instant access to all content during the subscription period.

documentation.text: @notice Returns the business/strategy model implemented by the policy.
@notice Verifies if an account has access to holder's content or asset id.
@notice Retrieves the terms associated with a specific criteria and policy.

@title SubscriptionPolicy
 @notice Implements a subscription-based content access policy.
